column4: hey guys is it possible to align the picture over hdmi in ubuntu on a tv?
you want to repharse that.. it dident make much sence
i want to align the picture on the screen of my tv. i'm not able to find anything for that to use my barebone over hdmi
the nvidia-settings tool here has settings to adjust the 'display' position.
if using hdmi, the  display should be set properly. except perhaps for any overscan settings
which package do i have to install for that?
do you have a nvidia card?
install a vnc server and you have a 'remote' desktop.
if you can actually 'see' the other pcs monitor. You can use synergy to controll it from the local keyboard/mouse
if your sustem has a nvidia card..  you most likely want the nvidia drivers.
check dmesg command output for any potential error messages,
deactivated ipv6 due to no exisiting ipv6 router
cant say ive herd about many ipv6 issues these days.
i first saw that now that it searched for an ipv6 router that wasn't there
i read about a few issues due to missing ipv6 routers
these days - im not sure it matters.. /boot/ on its own partion can be handy
ages ago there was a hardware limit the use of /boot/ on its own partion at teh start of the hard drive got around the limit.
